q: - Microsoft Chief Executive Officer Steve Ballmer , said to unveil new software for tablets at the Consumer Electronics Show next week, will face skeptics who say his company won't soon narrow Apple's iPad lead. By the time Microsoft gets it figured out everybody will already own an iPad, said Keith Goddard , CEO of Capital Advisors Google Inc. an investing firm in Tulsa, Oklahoma, that holds Apple shares.`` That train has left the station.'' to make-up artist Mezhgan Hussainy last February- admits he struggles to relate to very young kids, but would love to have youngsters of his own to play games with. He said: I worry about it- because of my age. When I was a youngster, my dad used to play soccer and games with me. And I worry that if I was 70.`` Also, if children could be born at the age of five I'd quite like that. I like them at that age when they can talk and understand. I'm not sure I could deal with the whole` ga ga goo' thing. But I genuinely like kids. In October, Sergio Marchionne ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy . Trade unions and politicians accused him of`` blackmail'' in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure. Sergio Marchionne

36, recently appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live and spoke about his pal and former American Idol judge Simon Cowell 's upcoming show The X Factor. Asked if he had spoken to Simon Cowell about it, he said: Actually I did hear from him, I spoke to him when he was overseas on a little bit of a break and he didn't comment about the new show.`` No he didn't bring up the new show. But he likes to keep his opinions to himself. However Ryan Seacrest said he is sure to hear from him if the show gets impressive ratings when it starts later this year. He said he wants to remain in private life although he is happy to be an informal presidential adviser.
